title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient is a left-hand dominant artist presenting for evaluation of his index finger pain and stiffness. The symptoms began after he lacerated his finger on July 16, 2025, while working with a chisel. He reports hitting a hard piece of wood, causing the chisel to slip and cut his finger. He sought treatment at urgent care, where the wound was irrigated and repaired. Sutures were removed approximately 14 days later, after which the wound reopened. He is now presenting due to the finger stiffness.
instruction: Summarize the History of Present Illness (HPI) as a coherent paragraph in clinical note style. Include only the patient’s history: onset, duration, location, severity, mechanism of injury, treatments received, and progression of symptoms. Do not include exam findings, imaging results, or any objective measurements. Maintain chronological order and use full sentences. Include information only if explicitly stated in the transcript. Do not add assumptions, inferred limitations, or negatives unless explicitly stated.
